record.attribute: The data at this site is provided freely for public use, through the contributions of many researchers including those involved in generating the genome sequences. The data is not guaranteed to be accurate as it often reflects the results of ongoing research. When using data obtained from PlasmoDB, it is important to cite the original publications and contributors of that data and PlasmoDB. Please see Citing PlasmoDB below.

When citing PlasmoDB itself, please use:

PlasmoDB: a functional genomic database for malaria parasites. Nucleic Acids Res. 2008 Oct 31. Aurrecoechea C, et al.

Much of the data in PlasmoDB is provided by independent researchers. Please cite them if you use their data. For a list of the data integrated into PlasmoDB and the related publications please see Data Sources.

The primary sequence and annotation contained in PlasmoDB come from many different sources, each with its own naming convention. Our philosophy is to retain as much of the orignal name as possible to enable users to trace sequences found in PlasmoDB back to the original source.

P.falciparum

Gene names provided by the sequencing centers have the following pattern.

  • PFcdddds where
    • c is either A, B, C, D, E, I, or L, which correspond to chromosomes 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 9, and 12.
    • dddd is a four digit number withleading zeros, e.g., 0370,
    • and s is either w (watson) or c (crick)
    • e.g., PFC0582c.
  • PFchr_dddd where
    • chr is one of 00, 07, 08, 10, 11, 13, 14,
    • dddd is a four digit number with leading zeros.
    • e.g., PF13_0016.
  • MALchrP1.n, where
    • chr is one of 1, 6, 7, 8, or 13,
    • n is a number,
    • e.g., MAL13P1.112.
  • chrchr-tRNA-aaa-n, where
    • chr is the chromosome number,
    • aaa is the amino acid, e.g., Asn,
    • n is a integer.
    • e.g., chr5-tRNA-Leu-2 is the second Leu tRNA gene on chromosome 5.
    • These are names assigned by the PlasmoDB Team. tRNAs on the unmapped contigs have unmapped instead of chrchr.
  • The rRNA genes follow a complicated pattern that always starts with chrchr.rRNA-, e.g., chr7.rRNA-1-ITS12.

P.vivax

Gene names provided by the sequencing centers have the following pattern.

  • Pvdddddds where dddddd is a six digit number roughly corresponding to position on the contings, e.g., 112125.

P.yoelii

Gene names provided by the sequencing centers have the following pattern.

  • PYddddds where ddddd is a five digit number roughly corresponding to position on the contigs, e.g., 00135.
